snippet: The Cibolo Creek Ranch, a 30-000-acre spread north of the Mexico border in the Chinati Mountains, is a confidential vacation spot for public figures.
abstract: Cibolo Creek Ranch, remote Texas resort where Supreme Court Antonin Scalia died, has served as refuge for diverse set of politicians and celebrities who crave anonymity.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and MANNY FERNANDEZ
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Houston, and Manny Fernandez from Austin, Tex.

lead_paragraph: The Cibolo Creek Ranch, a 30-000-acre spread north of the Mexico border in the Chinati Mountains, is a confidential vacation spot for public figures.

headline.main: Texas Ranch Where Scalia Died Is Rugged Oasis for the Famous
headline.print_headline: Texas Ranch is Rugged Oasis for the Famous
